translation.en: Quick. We can't hold them back much longer.
Open the doors. Come on, quickly!
is that in two days hence, the perfumer,
translation.ko: ‘이번 법원의 판결은 2일 후 집행된다’ ‘향수 제조자 장바티스트 그르누이는’

translation.en: shall be bound to a wooden cross
with his face raised towards heaven!
be dealt 12 blows with an iron rod...
breaking the joints of his arms...
He shall then be raised up to hang until dead,
and all customary acts of mercy
there lived a man who was one of the most gifted
and notorious personages of his time.
and if his name has been forgotten today,
it is for the sole reason that his entire ambition was restricted to a domain
that leaves no trace in history.
To the fleeting realm of scent.
In the period of which we speak,
there reigned in the cities a stench
barely conceivable to us modern men and women.
Naturally, the stench was foulest in Paris,
for Paris was the largest city in Europe.
And nowhere in Paris was that stench
more profoundly repugnant than in the city's fish market.
translation.ko: 파리에서도 냄새가 최악인 곳은 바로 생선 시장이었다

translation.en: [fisherman] Here we are. I'll get another box.
[narrator] It was here, then, on the most putrid spot in the whole kingdom,
It was his mother's fifth birth.
She'd delivered them all here under her fish stand
and all had been still-births, or semi-still-births.
[narrator] And by evening, the whole mess had been shoveled away, with the fish guts, into the river.
It would be much the same today.

translation.ko: 뭔가 달랐다 아기가 살려고 발버둥 쳤다

translation.en: -It's a baby. -[man] What's going on here?
Her own child. She tried to kill her baby!
translation.ko: 자기 애를 죽이려 하다니! 애를 죽이려고 했어

translation.en: [narrator] Thus, the first sound to escape Grenouille's lips
sent his mother to the gallows...
[man] Four. Well, three and a half.
As usual, more dead than alive.
[man] Just take the money and sign.
[whispering] That's not staying in my bed.
[narrator] For Madame Gaillard, Grenouille was a source of income just like any other.
The children, however, sensed at once
that there was something different about him.
By the age of five, Jean-Baptiste still could not talk.
But he had been born with a talent that made him unique among mankind.
It was not that the other children hated him.
Increasingly he became aware that his phenomenal sense of smell
translation.ko: 그는 차차 자신의 후각이 대단하다는 걸 알았는데

translation.en: was a gift that had been given to him, and him alone.
translation.ko: 그건 타고난 재능이었으며 따를 자가 없었다

translation.en: When Jean-Baptiste did finally learn to speak,
he soon found that everyday language proved inadequate
translation.ko: 세상 언어로 표현 못 할 게 있었으니

translation.en: for all the olfactory experiences accumulating within himself.
translation.ko: 바로 자신이 경험한 냄새와 향기의 세계였다
이건 다른 거 또 다른 거

translation.en: Madame Gaillard no longer had room for Jean-Baptiste
and therefore decided to sell him.
[narrator] From his first breath of the odor enveloping this man...
translation.ko: 이 남자, 독한 염색약 냄새로 찌든 걸 보니

translation.en: Seven, and not one sou more.
...Grenouille knew that his life in Grimal's tannery
would be worth precisely as much as the work he could accomplish.
translation.ko: 곧 시체가 되어 나올 게 뻔했다

translation.en: Life expectancy in the tannery was a mere five years...
but Jean-Baptiste proved to be as tough as a resilient bacterium.
He adjusted to his new fate
and became a paragon of docility and diligence,
slaved 15, 16 hours a day, summer and winter.
Gradually he became aware of a world beyond the tannery,
where a utopia of unexplored smells lay in store for him.
translation.ko: 난생처음 많은 냄새를 맡기 시작한 거다

translation.en: Come with us. I'm taking you to town for delivery.
and at last he was in his element.
He did not differentiate between what are commonly considered to be good smells from bad...
The goal was to possess everything the world had to offer in the way of odors.
translation.ko: 세상의 모든 냄새를 놓치지 않으려 했고

translation.en: [narrator] His only condition being that they were new ones.

translation.ko: 한 가지 사물에도 냄새는 수천 가지

translation.en: formed an invisible gruel, which he dissected
translation.ko: 한 가지 사물에도 냄새는 수천 가지 그는 각각의 냄새를 다 구별할 수 있었다

translation.en: into its smallest and most remote parts and pieces.
translation.ko: 그는 각각의 냄새를 다 구별할 수 있었다

translation.en: [man] He needs two dozen skins by next week. Can you do that?
Monsieur Pelissier, you are truly an artiste.
[woman] Please, take them. I've got far too many.
[Grimal] Next time you run off like that, I'll kill ya!
[narrator] That night, he could not sleep.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 그는 잠을 못 이뤘다

translation.en: The intoxicating power of the girl's scent
translation.ko: 그 여인의 향기에 혼을 빼앗긴 듯했고

translation.en: suddenly made it clear to him why he'd clung to his own life
translation.ko: 그 여인의 향기에 혼을 빼앗긴 듯했고 자신이 질기게 살아남은 이유를 알 것 같았다
자신이 질기게 살아남은 이유를 알 것 같았다

translation.en: The meaning and purpose of his miserable existence had a higher destiny.
He would learn how to preserve scent
so that never again would he lose such sublime beauty.
There were about a dozen perfumers in Paris in those days.
translation.ko: 당시 파리의 향수 제조자는 열 두어 명

translation.en: One of them, the once-celebrated Italian perfumer, Giuseppe Baldini,
translation.ko: 한 때 잘 나가던 이탈리아인 발디니도 있었다

translation.en: had set up shop in the center of the bridge
translation.ko: 퐁 상쥬 다리 옆에 가게를 차린 건

translation.en: called the Pont au Change on his arrival in Paris over 30 years ago.
translation.ko: 퐁 상쥬 다리 옆에 가게를 차린 건 30년 전 그가 파리에 도착한 직후였다

translation.en: To be sure, at one time in his youth
translation.ko: 젊을 때는 꽤 잘 나가는 향수 제조자였고

translation.en: Baldini had created several truly great perfumes,
translation.ko: 젊을 때는 꽤 잘 나가는 향수 제조자였고 향수 몇 개로 떼돈도 벌었다

translation.en: to which he owed his fortune.
But now Baldini was out of touch...
and spent his days waiting for customers that no longer came.
translation.ko: 손님 없는 가게나 지키는 처량한 신세이다

translation.en: I wish to retire to my study for a few hours
and do not want to be disturbed under any circumstances.
Will you be creating a new perfume, Monsieur Baldini?
He has asked for something like, uh...
I think he said it was called, uh...
from that swindler in the Rue Saint André des Arts.
You can smell it everywhere these days, Monsieur.
In fact, I just purchased you a sample.
In case you wanted to test it.
What on earth makes you think I'd be interested in testing it?
Actually... [chuckles] it's a very common scent.
I believe the head chord contains lime oil.
-And the heart chord? -Orange blossom, I believe.
And civet in the base chord,
but, you know, I cannot say for sure.
Well, I couldn't care less what that bungler Pelissier
And I am thinking of creating something for Count Verhamont
translation.ko: 난 베라몽만을 위한 향수를 만들 거다!

translation.en: that will cause a veritable sensation.
I'm sure it will, Monsieur Baldini.
Take charge of the shop, Chénier,
and don't let anyone come near me.
Is there anything else you need?
You are still the great perfumer Baldini.
translation.ko: 당신은 최고의 향수를 만들 수 있어요

translation.en: And a hint of cloves, perhaps.
I've brought the goat skins you ordered.
Tell your master that the skins are fine.
I'll come by in the next few days and pay for them.
You want to make this leather smell good, don't you?
Why, of course. And so it shall.
With Amor and Psyche by Pelissier?
Whatever gave you the absurd idea I would use someone else's perfume?
translation.ko: 다른 놈이 만든 걸 내가 왜 써?

translation.en: It's on your forehead, your nose, your hands.
It's bad, Amor and Psyche is, master.
There's too much rosemary in it and too much of...
translation.ko: 로즈메리가 너무 많이 들어갔죠 또 강한 향은...

translation.en: You have, it appears, a fine nose, young man, but--
My nose knows all the smells in the world.
translation.ko: 전 냄새로 세상 모든 걸 구별해요

translation.en: It's the best nose in Paris, only I don't know the names.
translation.ko: 파리 최고의 후각이라고요! 향 이름을 모를 뿐

translation.en: -I need to learn the names-- -No, no, no, basta!
You don't interrupt me when I'm speaking.
You are both impertinent and insolent!
Even I don't know every scent.
I've known for some time the ingredients
of Amor and Psyche, but all it needs to find that out
translation.ko: 물론 ‘사랑과 영혼’ 재료는 알고 있었다 그건 후각만 좋으면 다 아는 거고

translation.en: is a passably fine nose, nothing else.
translation.ko: 그건 후각만 좋으면 다 아는 거고

translation.en: But it needs the craft of a true perfumer
Could you tell me the exact formula of Amor and Psyche?
You see, you can't, can you? And I'll tell you why.
Because talent means next to nothing...
while experience acquired in humility and hard work...
translation.ko: 겸손하게 땀 흘리며 배우고 열심히 일해야 해

translation.en: I don't know what a formula is.
But I can make Amor and Psyche for you now.
Uh-huh. And you think I'd just let you slop around in my laboratory
with essential oils that are worth a fortune?
You shall have the opportunity now, this very moment, to prove your assertion.
Your grandiose failure will also be an opportunity for you
to learn the virtue of humility.
-How much do you want me to make? -How much of what?
How much Amor and Psyche do you want?
You must let me do it in my own way.
No. Don't drop that! That's pure alcohol.
You want to blow up the entire building?
You have to measure it first.
Essential oils are always to be mixed first,
And never, ever is perfume to be shaken like that.
I must have been insane to listen to your asinine gibberish.
translation.ko: 너 같은 걸 믿은 내가 바보지

translation.en: But it's not a good perfume, master.
If you let me again, master, I'll make it more better.
translation.ko: 기회를 주시면 더 좋은 걸 만들어드리죠

translation.en: Now it's a really good perfume.
Don't you want to smell it, master?
[Baldini] I'm not in the mood to test it now.
I have other things on my mind. Go now.
Can I come to work for you, master? Can I?
Uh, let me think about it.
I have to learn how to keep smell.
I shall have to think about it. Now, go.
I'll give you 50 francs for him. [coughs]
had a profound effect on all three parties.
Not least upon Monsieur Grimal himself.
translation.ko: 공장주인은 돈 구경만 하고 곧 죽었고

translation.en: As for Giuseppe Baldini, the acquisition of Grenouille
the mysterious secrets of the perfumer's craft began to unfold.
translation.ko: 의향수 만드는 법을 제대로 배우기 시작한 거다

translation.en: [Baldini] Now, pay careful attention to what I tell you.
a perfume chord contains four essences,
or notes, carefully selected for their harmonic affinity.
translation.ko: 그게 조화를 이루도록 4개를 잘 골라야 해

translation.en: the head, the heart and the base,
The head chord contains the first impression,
translation.ko: 헤드가 주는 향은 첫인상처럼 몇 분 후 사라져

translation.en: lasting a few minutes before giving way to the heart chord,
translation.ko: 첫인상처럼 몇 분 후 사라져 다음 하트의 향이 나오지

translation.en: the theme of the perfume, lasting several hours.
translation.ko: 그건 몇 시간 지속하는 중요한 향이야

translation.en: the trail of the perfume, lasting several days.
[sighs] Ha! Mind you, the ancient Egyptians believed
that one can only create a truly original perfume
translation.ko: 옛 이집트인들은 그 이상을 원했고 여기 한 개를 더 넣었다

translation.en: by adding an extra note, one final essence
translation.ko: 여기 한 개를 더 넣었다 13번째 비밀 재료를 첨가하면

translation.en: that will ring out and dominate the others.
translation.ko: 13번째 비밀 재료를 첨가하면 최고 향수가 될 거라 믿었어

translation.en: Legend has it that an amphora was once found in a pharaoh's tomb
translation.ko: 이집트에서 그 향수가 발견됐단 전설이 있다

translation.en: and when it was opened, a perfume was released.
After all those thousands of years,
translation.ko: 수천 년 잠자던 마법 같은 향수

translation.en: a perfume of such subtle beauty and yet such power,
every person on earth believed they were in paradise.
Why not? What do you mean, why not?
Master, I have to learn how to capture scent.
translation.ko: 주인님 향기를 잡는 법을 배워야 해요

translation.en: I have to learn how to capture scent
-You have to teach me that. -All right.
translation.ko: 그걸 가르쳐 주세요 일단 진정부터 해라

translation.en: "The soul of beings is their scent."
I will make you as many perfumes as you want,
but you have to teach me how to capture the smell of all things.
translation.ko: 이걸 알려주세요 세상 모든 것의 향을 잡는 법이요

translation.en: Then teach me everything you know.
And I'll make you the best perfume in the whole world.
to produce one single ounce of essential oil.
[Baldini] Now, keep the air flowing or the bottom petals will begin to stew...
while I set up the alembic.
And take care not to damage them.
We have to let them go to their deaths with their scent intact.
translation.ko: 꽃이 향기를 간직한 채 천천히 죽게 해야 해

translation.en: Now, help me with the Moor's head.
When the quicksilver is here, the heat is precisely correct
translation.ko: 여기 수은을 넣으면 온도가 정확하게 유지돼

translation.en: and the oil will gradually rise.
Note that this mechanism is a remarkable invention of my own devising.
You will observe how cold water
allowing the essence to condense here
Of course, out on the hillside above Grasse,
translation.ko: 남쪽 도시 그라스에서는 다른 방법을 써

translation.en: we had only to bellow pure, fresh air.
No man can rightly call himself a perfumer
unless he has proved his worth in that hallowed place.
The very soul of the rose.
How dare you talk to me like that?
You said I could capture the scent of anything.
translation.ko: 세상 모든 것의 향을 잡을 수 있다고요?

translation.en: What do you smell? What do you smell?
What were you expecting to smell?
You were trying to distill the smell of copper?
You told me I had to experiment.
What kind of a human being are you?
You can no more distill the scent of a cat
than you can distill the scent of you or me.
-[doctor] He is in stadio ultimo. -[Baldini] What?
-[doctor] He's dying. -[Baldini] Is there nothing you can do?
translation.ko: - 네? - 곧 죽을 거요 방법이 없나요?

translation.en: -He cannot die. -[doctor] Well, my fee is 50 francs.
You can't even name the disease.
You cannot do this to me. Please, don't die on me.
to preserve smell besides distill it?
Well, yes, I believe there is.
It is known as the mysterious art of enfleurage.
translation.ko: 향을 동물 기름에 노출 시켜 향수를 만드는 냉침법이 있다

translation.en: Not even I am intimate with its secrets.
But could I learn it in Grasse?
[narrator] Within a week, Grenouille was well again,
but in order to travel to Grasse and find a job, he needed a journeyman's papers.
translation.ko: 그라스로 가기 위해서는 여행 허가증이 필요했다

translation.en: on condition that Grenouille left him not less
He could have given him a thousand.
[narrator] The morning of Grenouille's departure, Baldini was pleased.
translation.ko: 장바티스트가 떠난 날 발디니는 무척 기뻤다

translation.en: At last, he felt rewarded for his many years of hard work.
He could not remember a happier day.
Deeply satisfied, he went back to sleep
and awoke no more in this life.
[narrator] With every step Grenouille took away from the city, the happier he felt.
The air above him grew clearer, purer, cleaner,
and at last he was able to breathe freely.
There were two ways to reach Grasse.
The first followed the winding roads through the villages,
while the second led straight across the hills and mountains,
Thus his nose led him ever higher,
ever more towards the magnetic pole of the greatest possible solitude.
translation.ko: 혼자 있는 그 느낌을 만끽하고 싶었다

translation.en: to believe that he had actually found a spot on Earth
translation.ko: 지금 도착한 이곳에는 놀랍게도 냄새가 거의 없었다

translation.en: Spread all around lay nothing but the tranquil scent of dead stone.
translation.ko: 코에 와닿는 건 죽은 돌 냄새 정도이니

translation.en: There was something sacred about this place.
No longer distracted by anything external,
he was finally able to bask in his own existence...
After a while, he almost forgot his plans and obsessions.
translation.ko: 그간 집착해온 계획도 잊을 뻔할 만큼

translation.en: And, indeed, might have done so altogether...
[narrator] There were a thousand smells in his clothes.
translation.ko: 그의 옷에 베인 냄새는 수천 가지

translation.en: The smell of sand, stone, moss.
Even the smell of the sausage he'd eaten weeks ago.
translation.ko: 몇 주 전 먹은 소시지 냄새까지 있는데

translation.en: Only one smell was not there.
For the first time in his life, Grenouille realized that he had no smell of his own.
translation.ko: 자신에게 체취가 없다는 걸 처음 알았다

translation.en: He realized that all his life he had been a nobody to everyone.
What he now felt was the fear of his own oblivion.
translation.ko: 누구도 자기를 기억하지 않는 게 너무 두려웠다

translation.en: It was as though he did not exist.
By the first light of next morning, Grenouille had a new plan.
translation.ko: 다음 날 아침 그르누이는 계획을 바꿨다

translation.en: He must continue his journey to Grasse.
There he would teach the world not only that he existed,
it seemed that the gods had at last begun to smile on him.
Picking together is always more fun.
They say you pick everything you find.
How many times have I told you not to cram the blossoms in
Look how skillfully he handles them.
The whole art of enfleurage is to allow the flowers to die slowly.
In their sleep, as it were.
Handle them as you would a lady.
Wouldn't you agree with me, Druot?
Stop it. I'm not in the mood.
-Fetch me back the ladder! -[Lucien] Fetch it yourself.
Tuberoses for Madame Arnulfi. She here?
translation.ko: 아눌피 부인에게 튜베로즈 꽃 가져왔는데 지금 계신가?

translation.en: Seems such a waste to boil them.
translation.ko: 이 꽃잎을 끓이는 건 너무 아깝네

translation.en: Or whatever you do with them.
So, what do you do with them?
The fat soaks up their scent.
Then I cool it to a pomade and...
and then I filter it before...
Before I add in alcohol and other essences to make a perfume.
No. Not now. I've got work to do.
-You must go now. -Come on. Let me look.
translation.ko: 어서 가줘요 - 잠깐 볼게 - 만지지 마요!
- 잠깐 볼게 - 만지지 마요! 튜베로즈가 왔군

translation.en: Why have you covered the tank?
To, to... protect the blossoms from daylight.
translation.ko: 햇빛이 안 들어가면 꽃이 안 망가지고

translation.en: Come with me. I'll settle your master's account.
To preserve their scent better, you say?
No. Then my experiment was a failure.
[Druot] Make sure it's your time you're wasting, not ours.
Come on, admit it. You're getting a bang out of this, aren't you?
Don't think you're gonna tie me up.
I've come across some strange men in my time--
[Grenouille] Just for scraping off the fat.
Then your perfume will be spoiled.

translation.ko: 못 참겠다! 돈이고 뭐고 싫어 당장 꺼져!

translation.en: Basting me up in all this goo. What do you think I am? A Christmas goose?
Quickly, blow them out before the roses melt.
translation.ko: 어서 불어라 장미 녹기 전에 초를 불어야지

translation.en: Now I'd like to propose a toast to our guest of honor,
His Excellency, the Marquis de Montesquieu.
May our trade continue to flourish.
[Marquis] I thank you all, and would ask of you the honor
to be the first to offer my congratulations to your beautiful daughter
translation.ko: 가장 먼저 따님에게 축하의 마음을 전하며

translation.en: and present her with a small token of my affection.
translation.ko: 작은 애정의 표시로 선물을 드리고 싶군요

translation.en: I had hoped that we would be on more familiar terms by now.
Let's have a game of hide-and-seek.
-Oh, yes! -[man] Oh, yes. But everyone must play.
[Marquis] Let the men catch the women.
Laura, have you seen the twins?
No, not since the game started.
I told that cretin ten times to get these ready.
[chuckles] Don't keep picking on the boy.
I'll kill him, the useless little sewer rat.
I mean, would you be good enough to prepare the enfleurage frames, Jean-Baptiste?
Jasmine can only be picked before dawn. We all know that.
translation.ko: 재스민은 밤에 꺾어야 팔 수 있잖아요!

translation.en: This could mean the ruin of our trade.
Supposing it's your daughter next time?
Of course a curfew is necessary,
but we also have to catch this man,
and the only way to do that is to understand
how he thinks, what he wants.
translation.ko: 그 꿍꿍이를 알아야죠! 놈의 목표가 있을 거요

translation.en: [councilor] I should have thought that was obvious.
And if I were to tell you that all except the prostitute
went to their graves with their chastity intact?
The coroner had each girl examined.
They were all found to be virgins.
Supposing there isn't a next time?
If we introduce a curfew, we may all go bankrupt for nothing.
translation.ko: 통금이니 뭐니 하다가 파산할 수 있다고요

translation.en: So we wait until he's killed, what, six, seven, eight?
We have to face the fact
that our police are helpless in this matter.
I suggest that we ask for support from Paris.
-[man 1] Paris won't be smarter. -[man 2] We must arrest every Gypsy in Provence.
translation.ko: 파리 경찰이라고 별수 있나요? 거지, 부랑아부터 잡아들여요

translation.en: -And every beggar. -[man 3] And every man without a wife and family.
translation.ko: 거지, 부랑아부터 잡아들여요 혼자 사는 남자도 잡고!

translation.en: We have to put ourselves inside the mind of this man.
translation.ko: 놈이 원하는 게 뭔지 알아야 합니다

translation.en: Each of his victims had an especial beauty.
We know he doesn't want their virginity,
so it seems to me that it's their beauty itself that he wants.
translation.ko: 성폭행 흔적은 없소 여성의 아름다움만 탐하고

translation.en: It's almost as if he's trying to gather something.
As if his ambitions are those of a collector.
Whatever it is, I fear he won't stop killing
translation.ko: 그게 뭐든 이 자의 살인은 계속될 거요
원하는 걸 다 구하려고 할 거요

translation.en: [councilor] This man, this man is a demon.
A phantom who cannot be fought by human means.
Now, I insist that we call upon our bishop to excommunicate him.
translation.ko: 주교님을 오시게 해서 교회에서 놈을 파문해야 합니다

translation.en: Have you no faith in the power of our Holy Mother Church?
translation.ko: 그럼 교회의 힘을 믿지 않는 겁니까?

translation.en: [Richis] This is not a matter of faith.
and we must catch him by using our God-given wits.
[councilor] I say until we submit to Mother Church,
we hereby declare that this murderer,
has incurred the sentence of excommunication!
Not only has this depraved monster
the young and fair blossom of this city,
has brought our trade, our livelihood,
to the brink of eternal darkness.
We therefore declare that this vile viper,
this execrable evil in our midst
shall henceforth be solemnly banned from our holy presence,
rejected from the communion of Holy Mother Church,
as a disciple of Satan, slayer of souls.
a necromancer, a diabolist, a sorcerer
Oh, God, in Thy most merciful spirit,
bring down thunderbolts upon his head
and may the Devil make soup of his bones.
He's been caught. He's been caught.
My Lord, the fiend has been caught.
And we thank Him for listening to our prayers
translation.ko: 주님 감사합니다 주님이 우리 기도를 들으시고

translation.en: This cannot possibly be the same man.
He admits to strangling his victims,
pulling out their hair and ravaging them.
The girls of Grasse were killed by a single blow to the back of their heads,
translation.ko: 실은 다 둔기로 머리를 맞고 죽었고

translation.en: their hair was carefully cropped, and not one of them was violated.
Antoine, we're all happy it's over.
-Don't argue with me, Laura. -Stop it. I'm going--
I know you must think me a very foolish man,
You don't need to explain, Papa.
If anything were to happen to you...
But you must stop worrying about me all the time.
Have this letter dispatched to the Marquis de Montesquieu immediately.
Stay on the road north into the mountains.
I saw them with my own eyes.
Why do you want to know?
Good afternoon. Do you have anyone else staying here?
Then I would like to take all your rooms for the night.
translation.ko: 손님 받지 마시오 여기 전체를 다 쓰겠소

translation.en: [innkeeper] It will be our pleasure, Monsieur.
And tomorrow, at first light, we wish to be ferried to the Ile de Lérin.
translation.ko: 아침 일찍 섬으로 갈 배도 부르시오

translation.en: It's deserted, except for a few monks.
With a superb view of the sea.
Do you have a room next to this one?
Yes, but the view cannot be compared--
I have no interest in the view.
Papa, will you please tell me now what's happening?
You haven't said a word all day. Why all this secrecy?
translation.ko: 하루종일 말도 안 하시고 무슨 일이죠?

translation.en: Last night I dreamt you were dead.
Murdered. Like all the other girls.
And the truth is, I'm convinced that the killer is still here somewhere.
translation.ko: 분명 놈은 근처에서 너를 노리고 있어

translation.en: All of his victims were young and beautiful
and who is there more beautiful than you, Laura?
it will surely be incomplete without you.
I've written to the Marquis, accepting his proposal of marriage on your behalf
and requesting that it take place as soon as possible.
Until then, you'll stay in the safety of the monastery.
And all this because you had a bad dream?
translation.ko: 겨우 아버지 꿈 때문에 이러시는 건가요?

translation.en: But I don't know whether I even love him.
translation.ko: 전 그 분 사랑 안 해요!

translation.en: I'm afraid the circumstances leave us no choice.
[guard] On your feet! Hands in the air!
Why did you kill my daughter?
Why did you kill my daughter?
when you're laid on the cross
and the 12 blows are crashing down on your limbs.
translation.ko: 쇠막대로 12번을 맞고 팔다리가 박살 날 거다

translation.en: And when the crowd has finally tired of your screams
I will climb up through your blood...
I will look deep into your eyes...
I will trickle my disgust into them...

translation.ko: 넌 고통 속에 온몸을 비틀 거고

translation.en: Let him be brought to the scaffold.
[woman] Is he coming? What is it?
-He didn't do it. It's impossible. -He's innocent!
[narrator] The people of Grasse awoke to a terrible hangover.
For many of them, the experience was so ghastly,
so completely inexplicable and incompatible with their morals,
translation.ko: 그들의 도덕 기준에 도저히 용납될 수 없었고

translation.en: that they literally erased it from their memories.
The town council was in session by the afternoon
and an order was passed to the police lieutenant
to immediately begin fresh investigations into the murders.
[narrator] The following day, Dominique Druot was arrested
translation.ko: 그다음 날 향수공장 공장장이 체포된 건

translation.en: since it was in his backyard that the clothes and hair of all the victims had been found.
translation.ko: 죽은 여자들 옷과 머리카락이 공장에서 나왔기 때문이다

translation.en: After 14 hours of torture, Druot confessed to everything.
With that, the case was closed.
By then, Grenouille was already halfway back to Paris.
He still had enough perfume left to enslave the whole world if he so chose.
translation.ko: 그 향수로 세상을 마비시킬 수도 있었고

translation.en: He could walk to Versailles and have the King kiss his feet.
translation.ko: 왕이 그의 발에 키스하게 만들 수도 있었고

translation.en: He could write the Pope a perfumed letter and reveal himself as the new Messiah.
translation.ko: 자기가 메시아라고 교황에게 알릴 수도 있었다

translation.en: He could do all this and more if he wanted to.
translation.ko: 맘만 먹으면 더한 것도 할 수 있었다

translation.en: He possessed a power stronger than the power of money,
The invincible power to command the love of mankind.
translation.ko: 인류가 서로 사랑하도록 만들 수도 있었다

translation.en: There was only one thing the perfume could not do.
It could not turn him into a person who could love
translation.ko: 할 수 없는 게 있었으니 자신은 사랑할 수도 사랑받을 수도 없었다

translation.en: and be loved like everyone else.
translation.ko: 자신은 사랑할 수도 사랑받을 수도 없었다

translation.en: So, to hell with it, he thought.
Grenouille entered the city through the Porte d'Orléans
his olfactory memories drew him back to the place where he was born.

translation.ko: 순식간에 그의 모든 것이 흔적 없이 사라졌다

translation.en: from the face of the Earth.
When they had finished, they felt a virginal glow of happiness.
translation.ko: 다 끝내고 나서 이들은 행복에 겨웠다

translation.en: For the first time in their lives
they believed that they had done something
Let's take them all home. You can wear them.
